title: A 40-line fix eliminated a 400x performance gap
summary: An OpenJDK performance optimization that dramatically improved thread CPU time measurement on Linux systems through a clever 40-line fix. The new implementation uses direct clock_gettime() syscall with bit manipulation instead of parsing /proc filesystem, achieving 30x-400x performance improvement with latency reduced from ~11 microseconds to ~279 nanoseconds per operation. Available in JDK 26.
actions: Located rank 3 post with title 'A 40-line fix eliminated a 400x performance gap'
Visited questdb.com article about JVM performance optimization
Captured 3 key screenshots of the content
